text: Q: What are some of the technical activities at VIIT? A: The technical activities at VIIT include Student Council, Perception, Robocon, Supra, Baja, Scitech, and Hackathon.
Q: What cultural events are organized at VIIT? A: Cultural events at VIIT include Aavishkar and Gandharva, along with various awards and achievements.

Q: What types of sports tournaments does VIIT provide for students? A: Every year, VIIT provides an open platform for students to participate in various indoor and outdoor sports tournaments, including International, All India inter-University, University West Zone National, University Zonal, State, intercollegiate, and annual inter-departmental sports.

Q: What personality development benefits does VIIT aim to achieve through sports? A: The sports program at VIIT aims to develop leadership skills, event management qualities, communication and presentation skills, group activities, team building, improved knowledge about worldwide sports, self-motivation, confidence, and awareness of social, mental, and physical health.

Q: What indoor sports facilities are available at VIIT? A: Indoor sports facilities at VIIT include Carrom, Chess, Table Tennis, Boxing, Badminton, Fencing, Judo, Wrestling, Shooting, Yoga, Squash Racket, Mallakhamb, and Rope Mallakhamb.

Q: What outdoor sports are offered at VIIT? A: Outdoor sports offered at VIIT include Cricket, Football, Volleyball, Basketball, Kabaddi, Kho-Kho, Archery, Baseball, Softball, Handball, Hockey, Athletics, Swimming, Cycling, Cross Country, and Lawn Tennis.

Q: What annual sports events are organized by VIIT? A: Every year, the sports department organizes an annual sports meet where all departments participate in events such as football, basketball, volleyball, cricket, tug of war, kabaddi, badminton, carom, chess, and table tennis.

Q: What is the purpose of selection trials in VIIT's sports department? A: The selection trials are conducted to identify interested players with knowledge and skills for participating in sports events, giving them equal chances and selecting the best team to represent the college.

Q: What is the Entrepreneurship Development Cell (EDC) at VIIT? A: The Entrepreneurship Development Cell (EDC) is a student-run organization that promotes and nurtures an entrepreneurial spirit among students, providing a platform to explore business ideas, gain practical skills, and connect with industry experts.

Q: What activities are organized under the National Service Scheme (NSS) at VIIT? A: Activities under NSS at VIIT include tree plantation programs, blood donation drives, guest lectures and seminars on yoga, meditation, and motivational topics, along with educational activities in the adopted village Jamgaon.

Q: What is the purpose of the Competitive Examination Cell (CEC) at VIIT? A: The Competitive Examination Cell (CEC) at VIIT is established to create awareness about various competitive exams held throughout India and organizes numerous sessions for students.

Q: What is Lighthouse at VIIT? A: Lighthouse is VIIT's annual magazine that serves as a medium for budding writers, poets, and artists to showcase their talent, with themes and concepts decided by students under teacher guidance.

Q: What is Rotaract, and what does it offer to its members? A: Rotaract is a service club for young people dedicated to finding innovative solutions to global challenges while developing leadership skills and building friendships worldwide. Rotaract clubs manage their activities and service projects, supported by sponsoring Rotary clubs.

Q: What are some of the other clubs available at VIIT? A: Other clubs at VIIT include AISA, EESA, MESA, CSI ACM, IoT Coding Forum, CodeChef, XRGF (VR and Gaming), GeeksforGeeks, Office of International Relations, I2IC (Industry Relation), and CESA (Civil Engineering Society).

Q: What is the vision of the Department of Computer Engineering at VIIT? A: Excellence in the field of Computer Engineering enabling holistic development for rendering services to the industry and society.

Q: What is the mission of the Department? A: To facilitate meaningful collaborations between our students, the industry, and society through internships, industry partnerships, and community engagement projects. To provide a comprehensive technical education in the field of Computer Engineering through rigorous academic programs and practical experiences. To create an environment that nurtures students' intellectual, emotional, and ethical growth through a range of extracurricular activities, mentorship opportunities, and character-building initiatives.
Q: When was the Department of Computer Engineering established? A: The Department of Computer Engineering at VIIT was established in 2002.

Q: What programs does the Department of Computer Engineering offer? A: The Department offers a four-year full-time undergraduate (B.Tech.) degree program, a postgraduate program (M.Tech), and a Ph.D. program.
Q: What is the current intake for the B.Tech. Computer Engineering program? A: The current intake for the B.Tech. Computer Engineering program is 240 students.
Q: What is the current intake for the M.Tech. Computer Engineering program? A: The current intake for the M.Tech. Computer Engineering program is 6 students.
Q: How many Ph.D. guides are available in the Computer Engineering Department? A: There are 13 Ph.D. guides available in the Computer Engineering Department.

Q: What are the key highlights of the Computer Engineering Department? A: The Department has received NBA accreditation for three years up to 2025 in Tier 1, with excellent placements (above 90%) and an average package of Rs. 8.5 Lakhs/annum. There are 618 placement offers from 200+ companies in the past 5 years, 7 entrepreneurs in the past three years, and a strong collaboration with industries and research institutes.
Q: How many patents has the Department of Computer Engineering secured? A: The Department has secured 17 patents granted, 31 patents published, and 13 copyrights registered.
Q: What is the total consultancy and sponsored project cost for the Department? A: The total consultancy and sponsored project cost for the Department is Rs. 98,22,700.

Q: What are the Program Educational Objectives (PEOs) of the Department? A: The PEOs are to equip students with sound knowledge of mathematics, science, and technology to solve complex engineering problems, understand and apply fundamentals of computer engineering, deliver social and professional responsibilities ethically, and develop communication, presentation, and entrepreneurial skills.

Q: What is the student internship success rate in the Computer Engineering Department? A: The student internship success rate has been 100% in the last 3 years, with over 500 internship offers from 300+ companies.
Q: Who is the head of the Department of Computer Engineering? A: Dr. Sachin R. Sakhare is the Professor and Head of the Department of Computer Engineering.
Q: What is the total number of publications in the Department? A: The total number of publications in the Department is 365.
Q: What is the nature of the B.Tech. Computer Engineering program? A: The B.Tech. Computer Engineering program is a full-time program with a duration of 4 years.

Q: What are the Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs) for the Computer Engineering program? A: The PSOs are to use knowledge to write programs and integrate them with hardware/software products in domains like embedded systems, data science, networking, and web technology, and to participate in planning and implementing solutions for business-specific requirements.
Q: Who is the Professor & Head of the Computer Engineering Department? A: Dr. Sachin R. Sakhare
Q: Who is the Assistant Professor & Associate Head of the Computer Engineering Department? A: Dr. Manisha P. Mali
Q: Name a Professor in the Computer Engineering Department. A: Dr. Mandar Karyakarte
Q: Who is an Associate Professor in the Computer Engineering Department? A: Dr. Kirti H. Wanjale
Q: What is the total number of labs connected to the centralized server? A: All labs are connected to a centralized server.
Q: What is the location of the IOT Lab? A: B105
Q: How many Operating System Labs are there? A: There is one Operating System Lab located at B205.
Q: How many staff are involved as Faculty as a Reviewer for academic publications? A: 11
Q: How many Faculty Awards have been received? A: 13
Q: What are some clubs in the Computer Department? A: CSI, ACM, Coding Forum, IoT, Cybercell, ML Forum
Q: What was the total number of final year students in the academic year 2022-23? A: 245
Q: How many students were placed in the academic year 2022-23? A: 183
Q: How many students admitted to higher studies in the academic year 2022-23? A: 19
Q: How many students turned entrepreneurs in engineering/technology in the academic year 2022-23? A: 0

Q: How many Data Structure Labs are there? A: Two Data Structure Labs located at B206 and B207.
Q: What is the location of the PG Lab? A: D205

Q: What are the subjects in Semester 1 of the Computer Department? A: The subjects are: Computer Networks (CN), Design and Analysis of Algorithms (DAA), Data Structures and Machine Learning (DSML), Software Engineering and Project Management (SEPM), and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR).

Q: What are the electives available in Semester 1 of the Computer Department? A: The electives available are: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), Mainframe Computing, Business Intelligence and Data Analytics (BIDA), and Computer Graphics.

Q: What was the highest package offered in the year 2021-22? A: The highest package offered in the year 2021-22 was 40 LPA.
Q: What was the average package for the year 2021-22? A: The average package for the year 2021-22 was 7 LPA.
Q: What were the overall placements for the year 2020-21? A: The overall placements for the year 2020-21 were 82%.
Q: What was the highest package offered in the year 2020-21? A: The highest package offered in the year 2020-21 was 33 LPA.
Q: What was the average package for the year 2020-21? A: The average package for the year 2020-21 was 6 LPA.

Q: What was the average package for the year 2018-19? A: The average package for the year 2018-19 was 5 LPA.
Q: What is the Vishwakarma Journal of Engineering Research? A: The Vishwakarma Journal of Engineering Research is a publication that focuses on research and development in engineering.
Q: What is the purpose of the Vishwakarma Research Internship? A: The Vishwakarma Research Internship aims to provide students with hands-on research experience.
Q: What does the National Service Scheme (NSS) focus on? A: The National Service Scheme focuses on community service and developing a sense of social responsibility among students.
Q: What is the NIRF ranking of the institution? A: The NIRF ranking of the institution is between 151-200.
Q: What are some of the companies that provide internships? A: Some companies providing internships include NVIDIA, IBM, Infosys, Accenture, and Hyundai.
Q: Who runs the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology? A: Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology (VIIT) is run by the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT), Pune.

Q: When was Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT) established? A: Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT) was established on the 16th of June, 1975 under the Bombay Trust Act of 1950.

Q: What are the objectives of Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust? A: The objectives of the Trust include offering technical and medical education, establishing research centers, helping needy students, and felicitating scholars and artists.
Q: What is the vision of the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology? A: The vision of VIIT is 'Excellence in Technical Education with Holistic Development'.

Q: What is the mission of the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology? A: The mission of VIIT is to make industry-ready engineers with high human values and impart technical, social, and entrepreneurial skills of the highest standards.

Q: Who is the current Director of VIIT? A: The current Director of VIIT is Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande, who holds a Doctorate from Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University and has over 31 years of experience.

Q: What is the educational background of Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande? A: Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande holds Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Electronics & Telecommunications from Savitribai Phule Pune University and a Doctorate from Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University.

Q: What are the research interests of Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande? A: Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande's research interests include Wireless Sensor Networks, embedded systems, IoT, Industry 4.0, and High-Performance Computer Networks.

Q: Which undergraduate programmes are offered at VIIT? A: VIIT offers undergraduate programmes in Artificial Intelligence & Data Science, Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering (Artificial Intelligence), Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, and Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering.
Q: How long is the duration of the undergraduate programmes at VIIT? A: The duration of the undergraduate programmes at VIIT is 4 years.
Q: Which postgraduate programmes are offered at VIIT? A: VIIT offers postgraduate programmes in Computer Engineering.
Q: What doctoral programmes are available at VIIT? A: VIIT offers doctoral programmes in Civil Engineering, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering.

Q: Which institutions are run by the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust? A: Institutions run by the Trust include VIT (Vishwakarma Institute of Technology), VIIT (Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology), VV (Vishwakarma Vidyalaya), VCACS (Vishwakarma College of Arts, Commerce, Science), VU (Vishwakarma University), and others.

Q: What social activities are conducted by Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust? A: The Trust conducts social activities such as charity work, donating medical facilities, awarding 'Adishakti Purskar' to eminent women, and organizing lecture series during Navaratra Festival.
Q: Who is the Chief Trustee of Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust? A: Shri Rajkumar Bansilal Agarwal is the Chief Trustee of the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust.
Q: Which institution does Vishwakarma Vidyalaya belong to? A: Vishwakarma Vidyalaya (VV) is a part of the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust, located in Bibwewadi, Pune.
Q: What grade did VIIT receive from NAAC in its second cycle? A: VIIT received an 'A' grade from NAAC for its second cycle.

Q: Which programs at VIIT were reaccredited by NBA in 2022? A: The programs reaccredited by NBA in 2022 at VIIT are Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, and Civil Engineering.
Q: What certifications does VIIT hold? A: VIIT holds certifications for EOMS 21000:2019, EMS: ISO 14001:2015, and ISO 2001-2015.
Q: What is VIIT's India rank according to the 2023 DataQuest Top Schools ranking? A: VIIT is ranked 46th in India according to the 2023 DataQuest Top Schools ranking.
Q: What was VIIT's rank in the CSR-GHRDC 2023 rankings? A: VIIT was ranked 13th in India and 6th in Maharashtra according to the CSR-GHRDC 2023 rankings.
Q: What rank did VIIT achieve in The Week's 2023 India rankings for private institutes? A: VIIT achieved the 78th rank for private institutes in India according to The Week's 2023 rankings.

Q: What awards did VIIT win at SUPRA 2023? A: At SUPRA 2023, VIIT won the Best Engine Tuning Award, Cleanest Pit Award, and was the first team to clear Technical Inspection. They also ranked 7th overall in SAE Supra and 8th in PiEV overall India.
Q: What was VIIT's overall rank in the SAE BAJA 2023 competition? A: VIIT's overall static rank in SAE BAJA 2023 was AIR-5.

Q: What services does the Accounts Section provide for students at VIIT? A: The Accounts Section provides services for students such as fee collection, fee refunds, scholarships, issuance of fee certificates and loan documents, support for student activities, and payments under the Earn & Learn Scheme.
Q: Who is the Deputy Registrar of the Establishments Section at VIIT? A: The Deputy Registrar of the Establishments Section at VIIT is Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar.

Q: What are the responsibilities of the Students Section at VIIT? A: The Students Section at VIIT is responsible for roll call preparation, student registration on ERP, issuance of certificates, transcript preparation, admissions, scholarship management, I-Card distribution, student data management, and the detention process if required.

Q: What is the main aim of the Administrative Department of V.I.I.T.? A: The main aim of the Administrative Department of V.I.I.T. is to provide satisfactory service to the external customers, i.e., the students and parents, and the internal customers, which is the staff of V.I.I.T.

Q: What sections is the Administrative Department functionally divided into? A: The Administrative Department is functionally divided into four sections: Establishment, Accounts, Students, and Examination Section.
Q: Who is the Deputy Registrar of V.I.I.T.? A: Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar is the Deputy Registrar of V.I.I.T.
Q: What is the contact number for Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar? A: The contact number for Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar is 020 26950207 (Direct) and 020 26950206 (Section).
Q: What is the personal email of Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar? A: Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar's personal email is vishal.pattar@viit.ac.in.

Q: What are the responsibilities of the Establishments Section? A: The Establishments Section handles planning and execution of visits of various expert committees, approvals for affiliation from AICTE, S.P.P.U., DTE, staff recruitment, promotions and retirements, maintaining staff service and leave records, teacher approvals from SPPU, documenting meetings, and managing inward and outward documents.
Q: Who is the Accounts Officer at V.I.I.T.? A: Mr. Prakash Pise is the Accounts Officer at V.I.I.T.

Q: What services does the Accounts Section provide for students? A: The Accounts Section provides services related to collection of fees, refund of fees, scholarships/freeship/fee waivers, issuance of fee certificates, student activities support, and payments under the earn and learn scheme.

Q: What are the responsibilities of the Accounts Section related to staff? A: The Accounts Section is responsible for monthly pay bill preparation, TDS, Provident Fund, and professional tax payments, gratuity policy renewal and claims, welfare fund payments, research project grants verification, and settlement of PF claims.

Q: What activities are included under Accounts activities? A: Accounts activities include maintenance of accounts, institutional transactions, banking transactions, petty cash management, internal and statutory audits, budget preparation, and implementation of fees as per Shikshan Shulka Samiti.

Q: What does the Students Section handle? A: The Students Section handles preparation of roll calls, student registration, issuing certificates, admissions, submission of eligibility to SPPU, scholarship management, I-Card distribution, and updating student information.
Q: What are the email addresses for Mr. G. H. Chavhan? A: Mr. G. H. Chavhan's email address is dr-ss@viit.ac.in and the section email is studentsection@viit.ac.in.

Q: What are some of the responsibilities of the Students Section? A: Responsibilities of the Students Section include preparing provisional and final roll calls, issuing various certificates, handling admissions, managing scholarships, updating student data, and preparing Google forms for gathering information.

Q: What is the purpose of the 'Schedule of Additional Institute Level Counselling Round'? A: The purpose is to inform students about the upcoming counseling rounds for admissions, specifically for the academic year 2024-25.
Q: When was the notice regarding 'Admissions 2024-25' published? A: The notice regarding Admissions 2024-25 was published on 03.10.2024.

Q: What information is included in the 'VIT First Year B. Tech Admissions' announcement? A: The announcement includes details about reporting venues for first-year B. Tech admissions for the academic year 2024-25.
Q: What recent change has been communicated regarding the VIT-Bibwewadi and VIIT-Kondhwa institutes? A: There has been a circular regarding the merger of VIT-Bibwewadi and VIIT-Kondhwa, Pune.

Q: What type of conference is mentioned in the text, and what is its focus? A: The text mentions the '3rd IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Distributed Systems,' indicating a focus on advancements in blockchain technology and distributed systems.

Q: What does the acronym 'IQAC' stand for, and what is its role? A: IQAC stands for Internal Quality Assurance Cell. Its role includes ensuring quality in education and maintaining standards within the institution.

Q: How can students find information about internships and industrial visits at VIIT? A: Students can find information about internships and industrial visits under the 'Industry Connect' section, which details industry advisory boards, internships, and industrial visits organized by the institute.

Q: What support does the 'From Desk of TPO' section provide? A: The 'From Desk of TPO' section provides insights into placement activities, recruiter collaborations, placement summaries, and training opportunities for students.

Q: What initiatives does the 'Research & Development' section highlight? A: The 'Research & Development' section highlights the Doctoral Research Centre and the Vishwakarma Research Scheme, aimed at promoting research activities within the institute.

Q: Where can students find information about academic departments at VIIT? A: Students can find information about academic departments such as Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering, and others under the 'Departments' section of the VIIT website.
